item.title: Microstate Graph Attention Network for Diagnosis and Severity Prediction of Tic Disorders from Electroencephalogram
item.description:
Microstate A shows enhanced connectivity centered on the parietal region, especially with widespread interactions involving P3. Microstate B presents strong connectivity centered on the left occipital and temporal regions, reflecting enhanced posterior sensory integration. Microstate C highlights increased connectivity in the inferior frontal , which may relate to executive control or speech regulation. Microstate D shows strong connectivity within the temporal lobes, suggesting potential involvement in perceptual, auditory, or semantic-related processing.

This work is driven by the results in my previous paper.
